job title: Research Scientist - cell culture, cloning, PCR
job description:
Apex Life Sciences is seeking a highly motivated and skilled Scientist I to join a top Molecular Oncology team based in Cambridge.

Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for developing and executing molecular and cellular assays and methodologies to support target validation projects as well as drug discovery programs.
  • Also responsible for developing, optimizing and implementing functional genomic assays and potentially screen assays for novel target discovery.
Qualifications:
  • BS degree in biological science or related field required; Master's degree preferred
  • 5+ years of experience in the area of molecular and cellular biology
  • Cell culture of adhesion and suspension cells, including primary cell culture.
  • Cell based assays (proliferation, apoptosis, cytotoxicity; luciferase reporter assays, Elisa western blot assay).
  • DNA and RNA isolation, PCR, RT-PCR and qPCR.
  • Molecular cloning (recombinant DNA cloning, PCR, plasmid preparation, DNA sequencing analysis, site directed mutagenesis).
  • Genome editing, Using CRISPR/Cas9 system to KO or KI gene in mammalian cells.
  • Design and perform siRNA transfection; inducible shRNA lentivirus infection and rescue with shRNA resistant cDNA.
  • Generation Lentivirus vector, packaging virus, virus titer, transduction mammalian cells and establish stable transgenic line.
  • Experience in cell imaging
  • Must be a strong team player with excellent oral and written communication skills and be able to work independently to design experiments, interpret data, and troubleshoot.
